item.title: Very bright street light outside 3 Wilkinson St, 11th December
item.description:
This light shines into bedroom windows very brightly, despite black-out curtains, it makes sleeping very difficult. Please could you put a shield on the house side of the light

item.title: Dead fox, 11th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, Greater London

item.title: Debris and Toxic spillage from Dustbin Lorry, 11th December
item.description:
Bin collection was 10th Dec and following this no street cleaning undertaken Down most of the road there is debris that hasnt been cleared up after bin collections Outside number 7 there is a toxic spillage. This is not the first time this has happened. Its grey, smells and dangerous to animals. Its a spillage from the bin truck which has happened before Street needs to be cleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plymouth Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole which is going down to the sub suyrface below near nr.39 Hook Lane, 11th December
item.description:
A pothole has been in evidence for months but it is getting larger. You can now see down to the lower surface underneath and it poses a hazard for cyclists and motorcycles and is also noticable in a car. It is located near the small traffic island out side nr.39 Hook Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Cars without registration plate, 11th December
item.description:
There are multiple cars without registration plate larked on Riverdale Road for months next to a “pavement garage shop” which always completely block the pavement access to the puplic. Vehicles ae untaxed and uninsured and should not be parked on public roads. Also that garage business should not be allowed to operate as it exploit public pavements and parking spaces. Also it does not looks like that any fire safety are in place there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Saunders Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction: Unauthorised Cones/Signs on Narrow Residential Road, 11th December
item.description:
A resident living next to the school has put up their own unofficial “no parking” signs / cones / restrictions outside their property to stop parents from dropping off their children. These items are not council-issued and have been placed on the public highway. This road is already quite narrow, with cars parked on both sides and large school buses needing to navigate it alongside parents and other road users. The unauthorised restrictions are adding to the congestion and confusing drivers. Could the council please investigate and remove any unauthorised signage or objects, and provide guidance to the resident if required?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Horn Park Lane, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In front of Woodrow House Canterbury Road, NW6, 11th December
item.description:
All along Canterbury Road , NW6 The Lights in front of Woodrow House and Across the Road ARE NOT SWITCHED ON. Have Reported and they are STILL NOT ON. Roads are Open Now and Cars SPEEDING Down the Road. IT’s FRIGHTENING. What if it’s a Child, Elderly Person, ANY Resident and because the Street Lights are NOT ON, There is an ACCIDENT? Brent Council WILL BE AT FAULT. This is RIDICULOUS. You have built Woodrow House Put Street Lights In front of the Block and they are NOT ON. They do NOT have Numbers on either. WHY have they been put up? For Decoration? The Road is PITCH BLACK at Nights so Visibility is LIMITED. The Street May look bright in the Photo, come down Canterbury Road at Nights and see how DARK IT IS. CRIME is also a Factor. If it’s DARK Criminals WILL ROAM. There has already been a HOMICIDE on Granville Road almost Two Years ago. CCTV and CCTV Signs were Requested as The Residents of Granville Road were FRIGHTENED after Witnessing The Homicide. Brent Council DID NOT BOTHER. Showing LACK of CARE and SAFETY for The Residents. Street Lights are IMMENSELY IMPORTANT. These lights in front of Woodrow Court, Canterbury Road NW6 MUST BE TURNED ON. Sooner rather than Later

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Neville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
